title: Improve Texture Visuals for DRC Terrain Model

content.raw:
The test world recommended by the DRC userguide (drc_sim_v0) is not suitable for proper testing of driving or walking scenarios due to 

  - the current multisense camera parameters (far clipping of 100)
  - persisting texture visualization bugs that have been reported more than two months ago (e.g. https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issue/239/bug-when-reading-common-dae-for-collision ).
  - low resolution ground texture + bad texture filtering (e.g. no anistropic filtering which would help keeping the ground texture sharp[er]).
  - heightmap is rendered lower than its geometry actually is is (due to a flat normal map being applied causing a constant offset to the actual geometry) ... when driving across the heightmap using the polaris ranger I also had fun bugs where the polaris was driving 5m or so in the air above the heightmap.


To visualize the problem here two pictures of a modified drc_sim_v0 world:

  - camera view in gazebo: http://i.imgur.com/lYDF1uP.jpg
  - atlas's camera view: http://i.imgur.com/7zi1PIF.jpg

As you can see the textures for the factory are missing (see above mentioned ticket), the ground texture is very low resolution and bad texture filtering makes this even worse (I know it's just a proof of concept world but I'm mainly mentioning this for consideration when designing the actual worlds), the robot can only see for a very short distance, when using smooth roads the road texture gets stretched very far which causes it to become very blurry (again, for future consideration when designing new worlds), and when moving the camera or doing stereo the heightmap terrain appears to be farther way than it actually is.

Also, given that we're talking about textures already, it would be good to bake lighting effects (shading, ambient occlusion, ...) into the model's textures in order to improve visual quality (important for perception algorithms). Atlas and the new ranger model are very good examples for this.
